Having gone forth to meet the One Perfected,
the Leader of the World, the Best of Men,
and having led him to the hermitage,
I sprinkled him with water from the lake.
For ninety-four aeons
I did not go to a bad rebirth,
this was the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the seventh of those aeons
there were four who were the best of feet,
endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great power.
